CatDescriptText: V.R. Davis, telephone worker, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 20, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In warning against attempting to assure the civil rights of Americans by passing "too many punitive laws," President Eisenhower told the recent National Conference on Civil Rights in Washington, D.C., that: 'I have little faith in ability of statute law to change human hearts to eliminate prejudice. All we can do is hold the line, and wait for a change in mental conditions.'  What do you think of his statement about the problem?" Answer reads: "I have a lot of faith in President Eisenhower and, therefore, whatever he said on the issues is a wise decision."
